sub_title: Research | Sustainability, human rights and gender equality | Global supply chains

education.degree_name: Msc in Environment, Politics and Development

projects.title: Public Interest Environmental Law UK
projects.description: The Public Interest Environmental Law (PIEL) UK Conference is a student-led, not-for-profit initiative that aims to provide an accessible forum for discussion, deliberation and debate. This allows a diverse range of practitioners, academics and members of the public to engage with problems relating to the environment and to encourage solutions. By increasing public awareness of the role that law can play, the Conference aims to foster environmental justice in the UK and further afield.

contributors.headline: Research | Sustainability, human rights and gender equality | Global supply chains
Water Policy Advisor, California Program at Defenders of Wildlife

projects.title: Stereoscope Magazine
projects.description:
Stereoscope is a magazine that celebrates student photography while raising awareness about the University of St Andrews’ photographic special collections. Working with the support from the university’s school of art history and the library special collections, the magazine is produced annually with an accompanying exhibition. Each issue explores a particular theme and features articles as well as photographs. 

My responsibilities as Layout Editor for the Lo-Fi mini-issue (2012) and the Everyday issue (2013) included designing the layout of the magazine; designing posters advertising events and submissions.

I then served as Photography Editor for the Noise mini-issue (2013) and the Volumes issue (2014), where my responsibilities consisted of: cultivating photography submissions; ensuring the vision of the theme and magazine is achieved; working with exhibition coordinators to create an event that reflects the particular theme and vision of the issue.

contributors.headline: Research | Sustainability, human rights and gender equality | Global supply chains

profile_positions.description:
Delivering research and advice to improve advocacy, policy and decision-making on key sustainability, human rights and gender equality issues in global supply chains. 
Areas of expertise include: 
> unravelling supply chains, including agro-commodities, minerals and plastics
> responsible sourcing policy and practice
> analysis of EU policy
> human rights issues in agricultural supply chains
profile_positions.title: Researcher - Sustainable Supply Chains

profile_positions.description:
Promoted to senior consultant following 2 years of leading responsible sourcing projects in palm oil, cane sugar and coconut supply chains with multi-national corporations. Clients included Unilever, Danone, AAK and McDonald's. 

Key responsibilities included:
> Understanding corporate policy, practice and expectations around accountability to address deforestation, human and labour rights in agricultural supply chains
> Building supplier monitoring systems based on corporate policy, external frameworks and expectations
> Translating research into strategic recommendations and adaptable outputs (reports, visualisations, webinars, etc.) for both sustainability and procurement teams
> Managing budgets and coordinating work between colleagues in teams around the world (e.g. field auditing team, data visualisation team, assistant project managers)
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Manager - Responsible Sourcing

profile_positions.description:
Supporting companies with responsible sourcing and working with multi-stakeholder initiatives towards sustainability in agricultural commodity supply chains. 

Some of my highlights were:

> Supporting the development of the Roundtable for Sustainable Palm Oil’s 2019 Principles & Criteria and Smallholder Standard, including facilitating public consultation workshops in Abidjan, Ivory Coast and developing the analytical framework for processing consultation comments received through workshops, interviews and surveys (over 6,000)

> Being nominated the focal point for supporting the gender equality mainstreaming programme across Proforest UK. As part of my role, I led the review of the Accountability Framework Initiative (AFi) draft principles and operational guidance to create recommendations for including considerations of gender equality throughout the documents and AFi development process.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager - Responsible Sourcing

profile_positions.description:
Focused on programme management support, as well as delivering research for ad hoc projects and briefings. 

- Assisting the management of the Tropical Forest Alliance 2020’s Africa Palm Oil Initiative (APOI) – a 1.5mil GBP, 3-year programme funded by the UK Department for International Development (through Partnership for Forests, Palladium) and the Global Environment Facility (through the Good Growth Programme, WWF-US). Led organisation of Regional Meetings and national workshops in Gabon, Ghana, Ivory Coast, Nigeria and Republic of Congo. Included engaging host governments, designing programme, inviting and briefing speakers, facilitating technical discussions and writing up reports.

- Supporting desk-based research projects including co-leading a scoping study for the expansion of SPOTT tool for the Zoological Society of London, which involved benchmarking transparency tools, designing and conducting the semi-structured interviews with key stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Assisting on various research projects, including for a Select Committee inquiry on the future of parks in the UK, and co-wrote a policy brief for Common Good Land Use.
- Responsible for the design and implementation of the new communications strategy, which included outreach for various events, such as a policy conference and a new training programme for local authorities.
profile_positions.title: Research and Communications Assistant
